channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Former USIP Lawyer on DOGE: ‘Brass Knuckles on an Authoritarian Fist’
item.description: George Foote, who served as the outside general counsel to the US Institute of Peace, said at WIRED’s Big Interview event that DOGE operatives arrived like a “strike team.”

item.title: David Hogg to Democratic Establishment: Get the Message or Get Voted Out
item.description: At WIRED’s Big Interview event, the activist and organizer said he doesn’t “think the Chuck Schumers of the world understand” what’s coming for the party.

item.title: Nvidia boss Jensen Huang steers Trump, Congress against AI chip limits and state-level AI rules
item.description: Nvidia’s Jensen Huang successfully lobbied Trump and lawmakers against a proposed AI chip export rule and issued a warning about fragmented state regulation of AI.

item.title: Chicago Tribune sues Perplexity
item.description: The newspaper is alleging copyright infringement and calling out Perplexity's Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) as a culprit.

item.title: All the biggest news from AWS’ big tech show re:Invent 2025
item.description: Amazon Web Services' giant tech conference re:Invent 2025 is happening this week with news ranging from chips to AI services.

item.title: The best noise-canceling headphones to buy right now
item.description: Whether you’re wearing them for the morning commute, while traveling, or if you’re simply trying to find some peace and quiet while working at home, noise-canceling headphones are a more essential piece of kit nowadays than ever before. And you’ve got a slew of great options to pick from; it’s hard to make a bad […]

item.title: It's Time to Save Silicon Valley From Itself
item.description: Big Tech has lost its way. At WIRED’s Big Interview event, Techdirt editor Mike Masnick and Common Tools CEO Alex Komoroske announced a manifesto designed to help the industry get back on track.

item.title: A Radical Cure for Internet Addiction Brings Chilling Consequences in This Dystopian Story
item.description: Read 'Reality Check,' a sci-fi short story by Hugo and Nebula-winning author Nancy Kress, right here on io9.

item.title: The disproportionate effects of AI data centers on local communities – and what can be done about it
item.description: How AI’s power, water and carbon footprints have a disproportionate effect on local communities, and what can be done about it.

item.title: Meta Poached Apple’s Top Design Guys to Fix Its Software UI
item.description: Meta wants to make its AI hardware slicker and more fashion-forward. It also needs to make its software more usable. The way to do all that appears to be hiring design maestros away from Apple.

item.title: Circle’s Jeremy Allaire: We’re Building an ‘Economic OS’ for the AI Era
item.description: The cofounder and CEO of Circle says “money as an app platform” is the next step in a digital-based global economic system that’s right around the corner.

item.title: Former DOGE Engineer Is Now Back in Government
item.description: Sahil Lavingia, previously a DOGE operative at the Department of Veterans Affairs, is now a career employee at the IRS. He said at WIRED’s Big Interview event that he expects to work there 10 years.

item.title: ‘Signalgate’ Inspector General Report Wants Just One Change to Avoid a Repeat Debacle
item.description: The United States Inspector General report reviewing Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth’s text messaging mess recommends a single change to keep classified material secure.

item.title: Android vs iPhone: here’s what TechRadar readers prefer
item.description: The results are in: Android beats iPhone for TechRadar readers.

item.title: How the CEO of Macy’s sees retail in a world of tarriffs and shifting consumer habits (and how he gets ready for the parade)
item.description: Tony Spring shares how the company is targeting the next generation of shoppers—and how he can’t obsess about things that are out of his control. It’s been a tumultuous year for the legacy retailer, shaped by new tariffs, shifting consumer habits, and the constant flip between “wartime” and “peacetime” leadership. Tony Spring, Macy’s Inc. chairman and CEO, shares why his team is now on “version 27” of the company’s forecast and plan, and what it really means to court the next generation of shoppers. ...

item.title: Score the creator-favorite DJI Mic Mini for its lowest price yet
item.description: As of Dec. 4, get the DJI Mic Mini for its lowest price yet.
